meanings.definition: The act or process of constructing with bricks.
meanings.sent1: The brickwork on the new house was done carefully and skillfully.
meanings.sent2: The brickwork on the chimney was sturdy and well-made.
meanings.sent3: The brickwork in the garden wall looked like a colorful puzzle.
meanings.sent4: The brickwork of the castle walls stood strong against the enemy's attacks.
meanings.sent5: The brickwork of the bridge was so precise, it seemed like a work of art.

meanings.definition: The finished product of a structure built with bricks.
meanings.sent1: The old building's brickwork showed signs of wear and tear.
meanings.sent2: The brickwork of the fireplace added warmth to the room.
meanings.sent3: The brickwork of the school's entrance resembled a welcoming smile.
meanings.sent4: The brickwork of the cathedral gleamed in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The brickwork of the garden path led visitors to the beautiful fountain.
